Package com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements

Class ElementFunctions

java.lang.Object
com.dougnoel.sentinel.elements.ElementFunctions
public class ElementFunctions
extends java.lang.Object
Retrieves as an element as a Element or as one of the following types: Checkbox, Dropdown, Radiobutton, Select, Table, or Textbox. To return as the desired type, we call getElement which returns a Element, and the element is cast as the desired element.

    static Element getElement​(java.lang.String elementName)
    Returns a Element object for a given elementName string from current page.
    static Checkbox getElementAsCheckbox​(java.lang.String elementName)
    Returns the Checkbox associated with the element name on the currently active page.
    static Dropdown getElementAsDropdown​(java.lang.String elementName)
    Returns the Dropdown associated with the element name on the currently active page.

    Returns the PageSelectElement associated with the element name on the currently active page.
    static Table getElementAsTable​(java.lang.String elementName)
    Returns the Table associated with the element name on the currently active page.

  • Method Details

    • getElement

      public static Element getElement​(java.lang.String elementName)
      Returns a Element object for a given elementName string from current page. Gets current page reference, replaces page name space characters with '_'
      Parameters:
      elementName - String name of requested element
      Returns:
      Element the requested element

    • getElementAsCheckbox

      public static Checkbox getElementAsCheckbox​(java.lang.String elementName)
      Returns the Checkbox associated with the element name on the currently active page.
      Parameters:
      elementName - String the name of the element to be returned
      Returns:
      Checkbox the checkbox associated with the element name on the currently active page

    • getClassCastExceptionErrorMessage

      private static java.lang.String getClassCastExceptionErrorMessage​(java.lang.String elementName, java.lang.String className)
      Returns an error message that is clearer than a casting error.
      Parameters:
      elementName - the element that was improperly used
      className - the page object name
      Returns:
      String the error message to pass to the user
